page.title: 16CHURCHES
page.content: RELIGION DOES NOT SEEM TO FEATURE AS PROMINENTLY IN PEOPLES LIVES NOW AS IT USED TO DO AS WE SEE FROM THE LOW FIGURES RECORDED IN OUR SURVEY.IN BOTH VILLAGES THERE ARE BAPTIST CHAPELS AS WELL AS CHURCH OF ENGLAND .SUNDAY SCHOOLS ARE RUN EVERY SUNDAY. {ST.MARY'S}MURSLEY.WE ENTER THE STONE BUILT CHURCH THROUGH THE LYTCH GATE WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1909.WE THEN WALK THROUH THE OLD GRAVE YARD AND ENTER THE CHURCH AT THE SOUTH END. TO YOUR RIGHT THERE IS A PLAGUE TO THE MEMORY OF THREE PEOPLE WHO DIED IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR.THE PULPIT IS IN CARVED JACOBEAN OAK.THE TWO MONUMENTS ON EITHER SIDE OF THE CHANCEL DEPICT THE LIFE OF THE FORTESCUES.NEAR THE PULPIT IS A PLAQUE SHOWING THE NAMES OF FITY THREE RECTORS.
